text: [Music]
hello I'm call a senior technical
customer service specialist at the AWS
office in Cape Town South Africa today
I'll show you how to identify charges
from AWS on your credit card statement
let's get
started AWS charges appear on your
credit card statement with a description
that includes your igit AWS invoice
number you can verify this invoice
number in the buing and cost management
concept
from the navigation pane select payments
and then click on
transactions here you'll see a list of
your AWS invoices and the corresponding
invoice
IDs match the invoice number from your
credit card statement to the invoice ID
listed here to confirm that it's an AWS
charge for example if your credit card
shows a charge description such as
Amazon web services 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9
then look for an invoice with ID 1 2 3 4
5 6 7 8 9 in the bilding and cost
management conso if the charge
description doesn't include a
recognizable invoice number it might
show a description such as Amazon
Marketplace payments amazon.com for
certain AWS charges if you still can't
identify that the charge came from AWS
talk to your bank for additional
insights alternatively you can contact
AWS support to contact AWS support
follow these
steps open the aw support
center choose create
case select account and building
support enter the acquired
information choose
submit if the charge is definitely not
from AWS and contact Amazon to
investigate further might be for another
Amazon service and now you know how to
identify charges from AWS on your credit
card
statement thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Music]
